greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least possible T(k) with T(k)-T(j)=n, where T(i)>0 are the triangular numbers A000217.
comment: For k see A138796, for j see A138798 and for T(j) see A138799.
The number of ways n can be written as difference of two triangular numbers is sequence A136107
results.author: Peter Pein (petsie(AT)dordos.net), Mar 30, 2008
